About GSEAdv

Lluís Revilla

August Pi i Sunyer Biomedical Research Institute (IDIBAPS); Liver Unit, Hospital Clinic
lrevilla@clinic.cat

14 September 2018

Source: vignettes/gsea.Rmd
gsea.Rmd

Abstract

Describes the background of the package, important functions defined in the package and some of the applications and usages.

Introduction

Bioconductor provides with the package GSEABase which provides the basic methods and classes to join, create, and manipulate the gene sets. However few (if any) packages take into account the relationship between genes and gene sets when using them. This package builds upon GeneSetCollection providing methods to describe the relationship between genes and gene sets, evaluate the relationship between genes and gene sets, and simulate gene set collections.

Installation

You can install it from github to get the latest version:

devtools::install_github("llrs/GSEAdv")

or from Bioconductor for a stable release:

## try http:// if https:// URLs are not supported
## source("https://bioconductor.org/biocLite.R")
## biocLite("GSEAdv")

Semantics

Thorough the vignettes and the help page a group of genes is both refered as gene sets or as pathways. A pathway or a gene set is defined as a group of genes (more than one) which can’t contain twice the same gene.

Also all the genes should use the same identifier type, Entrez, or a Symbol or Ensembl.

In order of doing this there is a function check that checks if the GeneSetCollection adhers to this principles:

fl <- system.file("extdata", "Broad.xml", package = "GSEABase")
gss <- getBroadSets(fl)
check(gss)
## GeneSetCollection
##   names: chr5q23, chr16q24 (2 total)
##   unique identifiers: ZNF474, CCDC100, ..., TRAPPC2L (215 total)
##   types in collection:
##     geneIdType: SymbolIdentifier (1 total)
##     collectionType: BroadCollection (1 total)

Usage

Once installed you just need to load it1:

library("GSEAdv")

The package is thought for three main cases, each one has its own vignette:

  • Description To provide insight about the relationship between genes and gene sets.
  • Evaluation Compare and estimate the relationship between genes and gene sets.
  • Simulate Given some approximations of the relationships between genes and gene sets creates a new gene set collection.

  1. To avoid a long message due to GSEAdv’s dependencies it is recommend to use suppressPackageStartupMessages when loading this package.↩
